revised_title: Anatomical Study of the Brain of Gadus and its Relation to Feeding Habits
tldr: The author examines the brain structure of Gadus, specifically the medulla oblongata, and its variations according to the feeding habits of different Gadidae species. They find that the pattern of the medulla varies in a definite manner based on the methods of feeding and the type of food. The study includes a comparison of serial sections of the medulla oblongata of the whiting and the roach, two different types of fish with distinct feeding habits.
